title: LPD: Boy shot by father "doing fine"
content:
TOPEKA, Kan. (WIBW)- The boy shot by his father last week is said to be doing fine.
The Lawrence-Journal World reports that the 10-year-old boy should be released from Stormont-Vail “in the next day or two.”
Lawrence police say the boy was shot in the abdomen in the living room of his home in the 6200 block of West 22nd Court. They say the boy’s father was cleaning a gun a gun as the two watched TV together.
Lawrence police say they had their first interview with the child Monday. Police say the father is being cooperative with the investigation. Sgt. Trent McKinley told the Journal-World he was not sure what charges, if any, would be filed.
